subject: JUnit4: assertEquals(int, int) gives different exception from assertEquals(String,String)
msgSnippet: While developing the parameterised test extension for JUnit4, I ve currently got two tests in a broken state (yes, I know). Both are using Assert.assertEquals
messageBody:
While developing the parameterised test extension for JUnit4, I've
currently got two tests in a broken state (yes, I know).

Both are using Assert.assertEquals - but one (the pair of ints) ends up
failing with a java.lang.AssertionError, whereas the pair of strings
ends up failing with a junit.framework.ComparisonFailure.

Obviously, both are test failures, and both have reasonable messages -
but is there any reason for the inconsistency here?

Jon Skeet
Senior Software Engineer
